snippet: The appellate court ruled that the town board of Tyre, N.Y, had violated the procedures of a state environmental law.
abstract: Appellate Division of New York State Supreme Court in Rochester rules that town board of Tyre, in upstate New York, violated procedures of State Environmental Quality Review Act when it failed to document its June 2014 finding that proposed Lago casino resort would have no environmental impact; ruling is potentially fatal blow for the $425 million complex.
lead_paragraph: The appellate court ruled that the town board of Tyre, N.Y, had violated the procedures of a state environmental law.

headline.main: Court Rules Against Developer in Battle Over Upstate New York Casino
headline.print_headline: Court Rules Against Developer in Battle Over Upstate Casino
